title: Rough start but tons of calls and social media posts got things fixed
text: Awesome product! However‚Ä¶I received a queen size encasement with pod as a Christmas present at a work gift exchange party (no clue who it came from). Anyways, those issues are slightly inconvenient- but not a dealbreaker. And I‚Äôll definitely recommend Eight products to anyone. Can‚Äôt wait to get a guest bedroom so I can upgrade to the pod üòÅ

text:

title: Excellent App, Very Well Thought Out
text:
This app pairs beautifully with the Eightsleep smart mattress cover.  Setup of app (and mattress cover) was simple, warming works beautifully (although be aware, in our experience, warming to levels above 3 or 4 can take considerable time.  That said, 4 is plenty warm enough with our flannel sheets).  The app is clear and very well designed, and very easy to navigate.  There is lots of data (toss and turns, breathing rate, even (planned) heart rate!) There are cool "experiments" to try in the "sleep lab," and IFTTT integrations are imminent.  Pre-ordered this via Kickstarter several years ago, and-- so far-- it seems to have been worth every bit of the wait!

Update:  With the new app, functionality is improved, as is navigation both within the app and the display of data.  My first Eight mattress cover lasted for two years before it broke irreparably. However, there was still no product that matched the features and functionality of Eight, so I bought another one.  Perhaps the issues I had were early adopter bugs, as my second unit has been going strong so far.

title: Needs a LOT of work.
text:
Pros:
The data it purports to capture is pretty cool.

Cons:
Crashed on initial setup, so didn't actually start logging until I (by mistake) re-configured the entire thing.
Product lost connection to app, didn't start warming on schedule, which is how I discovered I needed to reconfigure the whole thing from scratch.
Logging is horrifically inaccurate. I got out of bed in the middle of the night, shows I was in deep sleep. 

Smart alarm woke me up at the earliest moment because at that time, it thought I was awake as of 3:59am, so my 5:30 alarm went off at 4:59. Every time I've checked it thereafter, it's pushed back the time it think I woke up by 45 mins or so, to the point where now it thinks I was in deep sleep when the alarm went off and that I actually slept until 6:45. 

I'm going to give it a few more nights. I backed this on Indiegogo the first day it was available (January 2015 I believe, almost 2 years ago) and finally received it a few days ago. I am excited about the possibility, but I'm incredibly frustrated by it's performance so far, given that it's missing the most basic of activities and is incredibly inaccurate in logging.

As others have noted, it's also completely draining my battery. It has my 7+ at 60% by 8am. Force quitting the app stops the drain. For reference, I was previously hitting 60% after a full day of usage around 6:30pm.

Get your ish together guys. The software here is currently unacceptably bad.

title: Not as expected
text: Temperature data seems to be a bit off for the room; readings are consistently high. Doesn't seem to be able to distinguish between people and cats, which can sometimes be amusing but makes the long term averages useless. My main interest in the product was IFTTT integration, which was very late in coming and a major disappointment. What is the point of gathering sleep data only to require me to open the app and tap a button to trigger wake/sleep events? Completely missed the point. The smart alarm needs some work; it routinely goes off when nobody is in the bed, and can't be set to go off on specific days. Alexa integration to set the alarm would be nice as well. Makes a nice heating pad; looks like I'll have to rig up some Flic buttons for wake/sleep integration with SmartThings instead of being able to use Eight to automate it.

title: Inaccurate data and bugs
text:
This app has a lot to fix when it comes to acquiring accurate data as many other reviewers have stated. What's even worse is that it's impossible to edit or delete data.

There is currently NO delete capabilities, so if you have pets or someone else taking a nap in your bed (e.g. spouse/significant other taking a nap on your side), there is nothing you can do to get rid of that data and that pretty much screws future sleep analysis data.

A major bug is that this app constantly gives a 400 error when trying to modify existing data. So if your in bed, wake up, etc. times are wrong, you can't change it UNLESS you uninstall the app and reinstall it. And you have to do that EVERY SINGLE TIME you want to edit data.

title: Battery Drain, Inconsistent Data, Hope it will get better
text: I have two problems with this app and the associated hardware. First is that the app is a huge drain on battery consistently taking up over 33% of usage on a daily basis (I'm on an iPhone 7). I used to go from 7a-9p and end around 40% but now my phone usually dies around 7-8p. Secondly I find the data to be pretty inaccurate. Sometimes what I see makes sense, but when I went out of town for a few days it kept sending data as if I was sleeping in the bed. Unfortunately it is not something you can rely on. Until the app gets fixed and data is tracked more accurately, it feels like I just bought a large heating pad.

title: Very disappointed

title: Bugs make the app difficult and device disconnects daily from WiFi
text:
This app contains two significant bugs that make it difficult to operate.

First, the app will screen darken, I supposed to allow sleep, but there is no way to take it out of that state without going to home screen, shutting it down, and restarting. 

Second, when the alarm turns on, it triggers the native volume window which sits atop the snooze button. Instead of stopping the alarm, the volume goes up or down. Alternately, you can attempt to turn the alarm off by sliding up from the bottom, which brings up the quick menu screen instead of turning the alarm off. In both cases I wake up annoyed rather than refreshed.

From hardware perspective, smart mattress disconnects from Wi-Fi daily resulting in extra work to connect the device each night, missed sleep reports, and an inability to preheat the bed on cold nights.
